item.title: Best Open-World Games More Beautiful Than Real Life
item.description:
Open-world gaming has become all the rage in modern times, and players love the idea of interacting with these beautiful worlds and getting lost in what they have to offer. Sometimes, these worlds can be so lovely to behold that players will be lost for words as they explore these lush landscapes.

With the advancements in gaming tech, it's incredible to see just how modern games have evolved. The graphics in these titles are simply off the charts and are a treat to witness for fans who love the ethereal visuals of these video games.

Fallout 4

There's A Ton Of Beauty To Be Found In The War-Torn Commonwealth

Fallout 4
9 /10
53
8.8 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M FOR MATURE: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, STRONG LANGUAGE, USE OF DRUGS
Developer(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

For a post-apocalyptic world, the vibrant visuals of Fallout 4 are surprisingly captivating. Each and every corner of this stellar open world is full of amazing sights that fans will love gazing at.

Stepping into Goodneighbor and Diamond City feels great as players get a break from the desolate wasteland with these settlements and the work put into making them look visually distinct and unique. Even the Glowing Sea is hauntingly beautiful in its own way, although players will find this harder to appreciate when a gang of Deathclaws charges at them in this hostile, irradiated zone.

Horizon Forbidden West

The Beautiful Visuals Of The Decima Engine Are In A Class Of Their Own

Horizon Forbidden West
9 /10
37
8.6 /10
Released
February 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Horizon Forbidden West absolutely nailed its visuals. Plainsongs, Stillsands, and Dunehollow are all amazing locations to explore and show the incredible open-world design of this game in all its glory.

The Decima engine ensures that the Western United States will leave a lasting impression on players with its varied landscapes. It's easy to see why Kojima found this engine to be impressive enough for his titles.

Death Stranding 2: On The Beach

Boasts Some Of The Most Mind-Blowing Graphics Fans Can See In A Video Game

24 Images
24 Images
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
18
9.1 /10
Released
June 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Violence, Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
Powered by

Death Stranding 2 boasts some of the most incredible visuals fans can enjoy in a video game. The vistas of this game are in a class of their own, making the landscapes of Mexico and Australia a joy to traverse. The mere fact that the teaser showcasing the game's characters posing for photos gained so much traction for its graphics is a testament to the incredible work put into this amazing open-world game.

The graphics look better than real life in some instances of the landscapes Sam will traverse. The harsh reds of Australia and the detail found on rocky mountains are incredible. The snow physics makes these frosty locations engaging to travel to than real life, and the stellar starry nights will cause fans to stop their journey for a while as they appreciate the incredible beauty of this gorgeous, desolate sandbox.

Ghost Of Tsushima

The Stylized, Colorful Visuals Look Better Than Real Life

Ghost of Tsushima
9 /10
43
8.9 /10
Released
July 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Partial Nudity
Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Ghost of Tsushima proves that an incredible art style can do a ton of the legwork and let fans enjoy visuals that look like a stylized version of real life, especially as it takes them to the Japanese island of Tsushima, which houses magical beauty.

The incredible beauty of this world is something that fans will appreciate no matter how many times they check out this title. Given the incredible showcase of Ghost of Yotei , it's easy to see why players will love checking out more of what Sucker Punch Productions has to offer.

Cyberpunk 2077

Overdrive Mode Pushes This Game's Visuals To The Next Level

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
113
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by

The visuals of Cyberpunk 2077 are in a class of their own and ensure that players will love soaking in the atmosphere of Night City. While a smothering city might not seem better than real life, the saturated colors and realism make this dystopian future rather enjoyable.

If players have powerful hardware, then Cyberpunk 2077 can be played in Overdrive Mode. This extreme level of ray tracing makes the game look so jaw-droppingly incredible that players won't believe what their eyes are feasting on.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

CD Projekt Red Ensured That This Game Looked Better Than Ever, Courtesy Of The Next-Gen Update

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the greatest video games ever made. A next-gen update ensures that this game's visuals will be improved across the board, with the title being upgraded with everything from high-quality textures to the addition of ray tracing.

Geralt's adventures look better than ever before, with Toussaint looking absolutely jaw-droppingly good with this next-gen update. Of course, the brooding locations of Velen, the urban chaos of Novigrad, and the meditative landscapes of Skellige all look excellent in their own right and ensure that players will love exploring this beautiful world no matter where they go.

Red Dead Redemption 2

It's Mind-Blowing That This Game Looks So Incredible Despite The Lack Of An Update For Modern Consoles

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
169
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
Powered by

The visuals of Red Dead Redemption 2 are so spellbinding that PC players won't mind. Even the prologue area of Colter looks incredible with its snowed-in landscape and serves as a nice way to ease players into the world, with players being wowed when they set up camp in Horseshoe Overlook.

Players will love Arthur Morgan's beautiful adventures in one of the best open worlds ever designed. Witnessing the Old West right before a technological revolution is captivating, with everything from the swampy regions of the Bayou Nwa to the urban cobblestones of Saint Denis hammering in just how beautiful this world is.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Losing 5 Games Today, Including 3 Beloved Co-Op Titles
item.description:
Xbox Game Pass is losing five games later today, August 31, including three beloved co-op titles such as Borderlands 3 . Despite these departures, August 2025 has turned out to be an overall net positive for the subscription service, with more titles joining than leaving Xbox Game Pass this month.

Barring occasional exceptions, Microsoft typically removes titles from its subscription library twice a month—at the beginning and midpoint. The latest such catalog rotation happened on August 16, when Xbox Game Pass lost three games: Anthem , Farming Simulator 22 , and Persona 3 Reload .

Another five titles are now set to follow later today. The August 31 Xbox Game Pass departures consist of Borderlands 3 , Ben 10 Power Trip , Sea of Stars , This War of Mine: Final Cut , and Paw Patrol: Mighty Pups Save Adventure Bay . With the exception of This War of Mine , all feature cooperative multiplayer modes, with three of them—aside from Ben 10 Power Trip —being immensely popular among co-op aficionados.

Xbox Game Pass Games Leaving August 31, 2025

Game

Added

OpenCritic Score

How Long To Beat

Co-Op

Ben 10 Power Trip

Dec 2021

68

5–14 hours

✅

Borderlands 3

Apr 2025

81

23–82 hours

✅

PAW Patrol Mighty Pups Save Adventure Bay

Dec 2021

68

3–4 hours

✅

Sea of Stars

Aug 2023

89

28–43 hours

✅

This War of Mine: Final Cut

May 2022

86

11–67 hours

❌

PAW Patrol Mighty Pups Save Adventure Bay is largely geared toward younger audiences, which—coupled with its mixed reviews—might have contributed to it flying under the radar a bit. But as far as co-op games for fans of the puppy-starring franchise are concerned, it offers a consistently memorable experience. The PAW Patrol adaptation and Ben 10 Power Trip were both added to Xbox Game Pass in December 2021, enjoying the longest stint on the service out of these five departing titles.

Xbox Game Pass Added 5 More Titles Than It Lost in August 2025

On the other end of the spectrum is Borderlands 3 , which barely made it four months before being pulled. Short Xbox Game Pass runs aren't uncommon for 2K games, and this particular one was likely used as a way to promote the upcoming release of Borderlands 4 , which is scheduled to hit the market on September 12. Following the forthcoming departures, Xbox Game Pass will have lost eight titles over the course of August 2025. But the month was still an overall net positive for the service, with 13 new titles added.

Looking ahead, the next catalog update is expected on September 4, when Xbox Game Pass will be adding the much-anticipated Hollow Knight: Silksong . Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor is then arriving on September 17, followed by the Xbox Series X/S version of Frostpunk 2 the next day. The full Wave 1 lineup for September 2025 is likely to be announced on or around September 2, as Microsoft has historically favored Tuesdays for such communications.

item.title: Kaiju No. 8 The Game Shows Off Animation in New Cutscenes [EXCLUSIVE]
item.description:
Game Rant can exclusively reveal three action-packed cutscenes from Kaiju No. 8 The Game . This early look at the upcoming title arrives a day ahead of its mobile release, with Kaiju No. 8 The Game also being in development for PC.

Kaiju No. 8 is a Japanese manga-turned-anime written by Naoya Matsumoto. It originally ran on Shonen Jump+ over a five-year period ending in July 2024 and is published in English as Monster #8 on Manga Plus and by Viz Media. Its story centers on Kafka Hibino, who gains the power to transform into a kaiju and uses it to defeat other kaiju. After a successful anime adaptation and more than 18 million manga copies in circulation, the series was confirmed to be getting a video game adaptation, simply called Kaiju No. 8 The Game , in June 2024.

Kaiju No 8. The Game Reveals 3 New Cutscenes

In the immediate lead-up to its launch, Japanese developer Akatsuki Games shared some new footage from the upcoming title, which Game Rant can exclusively reveal. The previously unseen materials consist of three cutscenes, one of which sets up a confrontation between Kaiju No. 8 's Mina Ashiro and a 200-foot Kaiju. That particular clip also offers a glimpse of a largely demolished rendition of Yohohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture. While not shown in the video, Mina's tiger Bakko is confirmed to be making an appearance in the upcoming game.

In another one of the newly released cutscenes, Third Division Vice-Captain Soshiro Hoshina takes on Kafka Hibino's Kaiju form. The scene showcases a few of Hoshina's abilities that Kaiju No. 8 fans will be familiar with, establishing him as a fast and tricky fighter while underscoring the game's overall faithfulness to the source material. The clip also serves to showcase some sleek animation that Kaiju No. 8 The Game is set to offer.

The third clip also features Hibino, this time duking it out with Isao Shinomiya, the Defense Force Director General. Both of them will be part of Kaiju No 8. The Game 's playable character roster, together with Mina, Hoshina, Gen Narumi, Kikoru Shinomiya, and Reno Ichikawa.

Kaiju No. 8 The Game is scheduled for release this Sunday, August 31. It will launch simultaneously on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store. In addition to Android and iOS devices, the free-to-play adaptation of the popular sci-fi anime is also on its way to PC. Its Steam page has it listed as "coming soon," with more concrete availability details being expected to follow in the coming months.

Follow
Followed
Kaiju No. 8 The Game

Tactical
Systems
Developer(s)
Akatsuki Games
Publisher(s)
Akatsuki Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

item.title: Best PS3 RPGs That Get Better As You Play
item.description:
Summary

  • Some PS3 RPGs, like Alpha Protocol , had rough starts but improved with time and patches.
  • Demon's Souls changed RPGs forever with its challenging gameplay and rewarding experience.
  • White Knight Chronicles offers giant mech-like knights in MMO-style combat with slow story progression.

The PS3 as a whole was kind of a console that got better over time. Its launch was rough in 2006, as it was more expensive than the Wii, which launched alongside it, and the Xbox 360, which preceded it in 2005. The games simply weren’t there for years until the magical year of 2008, when things started to turn for the console with the release of Grand Theft Auto 4 and Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots . It took longer to get some good RPGs on Sony's seventh-gen hardware, though.

While the PS3’s RPG library is not as mighty as the PS1’s or PS2’s, there are plenty of good games that are still worth checking out, especially RPGs. Like the PS3, these RPGs didn't start strong , and here are some key examples from across a wide range of RPG genres, from action to turn-based.

Alpha Protocol

A Forgotten Spy RPG

Alpha Protocol
Action RPG
Systems
Released
June 1, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Obsidian Entertainment’s big breakout hit that fans still love from the PS3 era is Fallout: New Vegas , despite all the bugs that plagued it at launch. Alpha Protocol is the forgotten one-off that has been delisted from many storefronts, which is a shame. It too had a rough launch, which improved with patches.

The game itself did, admittedly, have a slow start. It’s a spy RPG where the gameplay doesn’t flow well until a few missions in. It feels like it wants to be a Deus Ex game badly, and it eventually gets there, but Alpha Protocol can test players' patience in the early goings.

Demon’s Souls

Prepare To Die

Demon's Souls
10.0 /10
Released
October 6, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Violence
Powered by

Demon’s Souls changed RPGs forever as FromSoftware's first Souls game, one that the company probably thought would be a one-off. Thanks to players sticking with it, they helped uncover a deep action RPG that was beyond anything that came before it.

That said, it is understandable why so many people quit Demon's Souls after a few hours. It can feel like a waste of time when EXP is lost time and time again. There’s a learning curve, without a doubt, but those up for the challenge will be rewarded.

Dragon’s Dogma

Medieval Monster Hunter

Dragon's Dogma
6 /10
Released
May 22, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Dragon’s Dogma was sort of like Capcom’s attempt at a Soulslike game, combined with their Monster Hunter franchise. Players could create their character and subordinate, a Pawn, and then go on an epic quest while fighting against gigantic monsters like cyclops or Medusa-like creatures.

Feeling any sort of achievement is hard thanks to the complicated controls and gameplay features, but over time, they become second nature. Dragon's Dogma can honestly make Demon’s Souls’ mechanics seem easy to pick up and play, but like that game, Dragon’s Dogma found its fans who stuck with it.

Final Fantasy 13

It Gets Good Forty Hours In

Final Fantasy 13
6 /10
7.7 /10
Released
March 9, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Final Fantasy 13 was a major departure for the franchise, as it featured a very linear experience. Also, players could not choose their party members. Instead, they came and went with the story, which was fragmented.

It takes about forty hours, but an open-world-like segment does unlock towards the last third of the game. For some, it was kind of too little, too late, but a lot of Final Fantasy fans did indeed start to enjoy themselves more after this point. For what it is, Final Fantasy 13 is good even during the linear parts, but it does take some time to get used to.

NieR

A Long Road To Fun

Nier
Action RPG
Systems
Released
April 27, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

NieR opens with a feeling of forlornness, like players are jumping into an RPG character’s life at the end of their epic quest. The nameless protagonist doesn’t say much, and there’s a lot of running around without action. Even when there is action, it doesn’t feel great for an RPG.

Eventually, players will get a book named Grimoire, who unlocks magic and adds some flavor to the story and gameplay. Two other characters join the adventure, and once the party is fully assembled, NieR feels like the start of something epic.

Ni No Kuni: Wrath Of The White Witch

Stop Crying And Catch Pokemon

Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch
9.5 /10
Released
January 22, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Alcohol and Tobacco Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling
Powered by

Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch is one of the PS3’s best RPGs and a genuine competitor for one of the best monster-catching games next to the Pokemon series. That said, Oliver’s journey couldn’t be more frustrating, as he lacks any self-confidence and is understandably sad about his mom.

Even after Oliver travels to another world and the battles start, players won’t have much to add to combat. It takes at least twenty hours to get all three party members, and then the combat will start to click more.

Resonance Of Fate

A Steep Learning Curve

Resonance Of Fate
JRPG
Fantasy
Narrative
Systems
Released
January 28, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Resonance of Fate will not waste time getting the player's party together, as all three characters will be unlocked from the start. That’s a good thing, but the combat is the problem, because it is far more complex than it needs to be.

Players have to be aware of their line of sight in battle, along with their movement, which gives it more of a tactical feel. When players learn to pull off moves like they are directing an action anime, that’s when Resonance of Fate gets extremely fun, but it won’t hold their hand at all.

White Knight Chronicles

Get To The Mecha Knight Already

White Knight Chronicles
JRPG
Systems
4 /10
Released
December 25, 2008
ESRB
T For Teen Due To Mild Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence

Powered by

White Knight Chronicles is a bit generic around the edges, featuring a silent player character and a story taken straight from the RPG handbook. It also starts slowly before the world opens up to get to some combat and free-flowing quests.

The gameplay is what players should come to White Knight Chronicles for, as it is similar to MMOs. The big hook is the giant mech-like knight that players can summon in combat to fight some of the bigger monsters. Once that element shows up, the whole game becomes a lot more fun.

item.title: Coral Island: All Fish Locations
item.description:
Fishing is one of the most rewarding and calming activities you can do on Coral Island . Not only does it allow you to make money, but it’s also a major part of completing the Lake Temple offerings , progressing through quests, and unlocking legendary species that become a true badge of honor for dedicated players.

While the minigame itself is simple; cast, wait, and play the tension bar carefully to reel in your catch, the real challenge lies in knowing where to fish and when. Some fish only appear during specific times of the day, under certain weather conditions, or even in one precise location on the map. This guide covers all fish locations on Coral Island , organized by region, with details about availability and weather requirements.

All Fish Locations in Coral Island

On Coral Island , you can fish anywhere there's water, but the type of fish you catch depends on the time of day and the specific body of water you're fishing in.

Given below is the complete list of fish available in Coral Island , along with the times, locations, and seasons they can be caught.
